intro: Piper ledezmae, commonly known as the Lédezma pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the humid forests of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant produces small, green berries that turn red when mature, and it is valued for its aromatic leaves used in traditional medicine. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
